TITLE: Blood-sucking body lice may have spread plague more than thought, science suggests
SUMMARY: Lab experiments support the possibility that the blood-sucking bugs may have played a role in the rapid spread of the plague in the Middle Ages

TITLE: Hundreds of mountain goats were flown to a new home. Very few survived.
SUMMARY: After mountain goats were moved into Washington state's Cascade Mountains, most died within a few years — bringing scientists' attention to a broader threat to the species

TITLE: Turbulence-related deaths are rare, but climate change is making for bumpier air travel
SUMMARY: From 2009 to 2023, turbulence resulted in 185 serious injuries aboard commercial planes, but there were no turbulence-related deaths in the U.S. in that time, officials said

TITLE: Extreme heat hits Texas and Florida early in the season
SUMMARY: Miami's heat index has already smashed the previous record — and it's only May

TITLE: A helium leak in Boeing's spaceship will further delay its first flight with astronauts
SUMMARY: The Starliner's launch, previously scheduled for Saturday, is now on hold, with the next possible launch date still under discussion

TITLE: NOAA issues highest-ever early forecast for the coming hurricane season
SUMMARY: Agency forecasters predict an exceptionally busy year for storms, with eight to 13 hurricanes

TITLE: A vintage find: Man discovers mammoth bones in wine cellar
SUMMARY: “I thought it was just a piece of wood left by my grandfather,” said Andreas Pernerstorfer

TITLE: A potentially habitable Earth-size planet was discovered just 40 light-years away
SUMMARY: Dubbed Gliese 12 b, the planet takes 12.8 days to orbit a star that is 27% of the sun’s size

TITLE: Canadian wildfires trigger air quality alerts across 4 U.S. states
SUMMARY: Winds have carried plumes of smoke over Montana, North Dakota, South Dakota and Minnesota

TITLE: Big banks still funnel hundreds of billions into the fossil fuel industry, report shows
SUMMARY: Activists have long sought to put pressure on the money that undergirds oil, gas and coal. But a report shows how global banks continue to finance fossil-fuel-related endeavors
